Resource.description: Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources (e.g. TPE, EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. For resources pf type 'Equipment', baseType can be 'PhysicalResource'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@type.description: Indicates the type of resource. For physical resource this will be 'Equipment', For logical Resource this can be 'Resource Function' , 'MSISDN', 'IP Address'.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is effective

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources (e.g. TPE, EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

endDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is effective

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

PhysicalResource.description: Physical resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete physical resources (e.g. EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. For resources pf type 'Equipment', baseType can be 'PhysicalResource'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@type.description: Indicates the type of resource. For physical resource this will be 'Equipment', For logical Resource this can be 'Resource Function' , 'MSISDN', 'IP Address'.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is effective

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

manufactureDate.description: This is a string attribute that defines the date of manufacture of this item in the fixed format "dd/mm/yyyy". This is an optional attribute.

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

serialNumber.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify different instances of the same hardware item. The ModelNumber and PartNumber attributes are used to identify different types of hardware items. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

versionNumber.description: This is a string that identifies the version of this object. This is an optional attribute.

LogicalResource.description: Logic resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete logical resources (e.g. TPE, MSISDN, IP Addresses) in the inventory.

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. For resources pf type 'Equipment', baseType can be 'PhysicalResource'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@type.description: Indicates the type of resource. For physical resource this will be 'Equipment', For logical Resource this can be 'Resource Function' , 'MSISDN', 'IP Address'.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is effective

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

endDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is effective

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

startDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is effective

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

type.description:
Linked Resources to the one instantiate, it can be :
- "reliesOn" if the Resource needs another already owned Resource to rely on 
- "targets" or "isTargeted" (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

Place.description: Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

address.description: A string characterizing an address (for instance a formatted address or an identifier taken from an address database or an address API)

geoLocationUrl.description: A url providing a map for localizing the place

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as "Paris Store", "London Store", "Main Home".

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'home delivery', 'shop retrieval')

PartyRoleRef.description: Party role reference. A party role represents the part played by a party in a given context.

name.description: The name of the referred party role.

partyId.description: The identifier of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

partyName.description: The name of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

Note.description: Extra information about the ticket or a product order

TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod
